line_1: With wadling Steps and frowzy Poles,
line_2: You'd joy to see the pretty Souls,

line_1: With wadling Steps and frowzy Poles,
line_2: Come creeping from their secret Holes.

line_1: Till the last fire burn all between the poles.
line_2: Nor shall be found in unregen'rate souls,

line_1: And Love refin'd like that above the Poles
line_2: Threw both our Arms round one anothers Souls

line_1: Like Heaven's own thunder round the echoing poles;
line_2: Calls to the Good and Brave with voice, that rolls

line_1: LIFE buds or breathes from Indus to the Poles,
line_2: And the vast surface kindles, as it rolls!

line_1: SIng aloud to the Lord: Let the two Frozen Poles
line_2: At the Fiery Line will we kindle our Souls,

line_1: Torrid and Frigid scale, and joyn the Poles,
line_2: And far as Wind can blow, or Water rolls,

line_1: Launces the Bolt, and shakes the Poles;
line_2: Tho' Momus laughs, and Juno scolds.
